{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3016404,"name":"Derek","username":"NagloKehn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T20:16:31.284Z","cooked":"

Our team is still using last years CTRE PCM and we are running into an issue where none of the code from last year is working anymore; as well as all the new code for the digital PCM’s don’t work. Does anybody have an idea of how to do this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T20:16:31.284Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":150,"reads":188,"readers_count":187,"score":787.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Derek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51079,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/1","custom_user_title":"Co-Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3016410,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T20:26:01.820Z","cooked":"

The API changed to require you to specify the type of pneumatic controller that is in use.

Our team uses C++ but the API is similar for Java - you’ll see the addition of the “PneumaticsModuleType moduleType”.

This wasn’t in the API last year because there was only a single PCM module but now there are two.

[ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/2","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016415,"name":"Derek","username":"NagloKehn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T20:30:31.002Z","cooked":"

Our code does have this in it but it seems as though the new code to enable the ClosedLoopControl only works for digital input and ours is analog.

here is our code for it
private final Compressor comp = new Compressor(0, PneumaticsModuleType.CTREPCM);

comp.enableDigital();

the comp.enableAnalog(); only works for the new Rev Hub

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T20:30:31.002Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":41.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Derek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":40142,"username":"zog","name":"Chris Herzog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51079,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/4","custom_user_title":"Co-Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016422,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T20:40:58.890Z","cooked":"
NagloKehn:

only works for digital input and ours is analog

The CTRE PCM hardware does not have an analog input. You have to use a digital pressure switch with the PCM.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T20:42:54.057Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/5","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016425,"name":"Derek","username":"NagloKehn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T20:45:01.154Z","cooked":"

Sorry, I probably use the wrong word.
Our set up runs the compressor through a relay and we have our pressure switch into the pressure switch input on the old style PCM. How would we go about using the new code for it?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T20:46:05.874Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Derek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51079,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/6","custom_user_title":"Co-Captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016426,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T20:48:22.154Z","cooked":"

I don’t think that’s a legal configuration per R812.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T20:48:22.154Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":22.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51079,"username":"NagloKehn","name":"Derek","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016429,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T20:50:24.012Z","cooked":"

If you’re using a separate relay (such as a Spike) to control the compressor instead of using the PCM, you will need to hook up the pressure switch to a RoboRio DIO, read the pressure switch state and control the relay yourself in the RoboRIO code (see R812).

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T20:51:08.958Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":44.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51079,"username":"NagloKehn","name":"Derek","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/8","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016435,"name":"Derek","username":"NagloKehn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T20:57:13.966Z","cooked":"

The pressure switch is connected to the pressure switch input of the PCM. The Compressor out of the PCM is activating the relay that powers the compressor. We just have the relay there to reduce power draw through the PCM. So the PCM is still controlling the compressor on/off.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T20:57:13.966Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":24,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":147.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Derek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51079,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/9","custom_user_title":"Co-Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016472,"name":"Derek","username":"NagloKehn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T21:47:43.233Z","cooked":"

Turns out that our pressure switch was faulty. And I also moved the command to enableDigital into the robot file’s teleopInit; from a subsystem (we are using command based).

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T21:47:43.233Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":26.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Derek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51079,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/10","custom_user_title":"Co-Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016505,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T22:38:57.716Z","cooked":"
NagloKehn:

The pressure switch is connected to the pressure switch input of the PCM. The Compressor out of the PCM is activating the relay that powers the compressor. We just have the relay there to reduce power draw through the PCM. So the PCM is still controlling the compressor on/off.

This is not a legal configuration for the compressor. It either must be hooked up to a Relay, and that relay must be directly controlled by a relay output on the roborio, or it must be hooked directly to the PCM with nothing in between.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T22:38:57.716Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":150.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/11","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016519,"name":"Derek","username":"NagloKehn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T23:34:31.056Z","cooked":"

I think you are misunderstanding. The pressure switch is directly connected to the PCM. So everything in R812 after the ‘or’ about connecting the pressure switch to the roborio is irrelevant. The PCM is turning on and off the compressor. The compressor out of the PCM is controlling power to the relay for compressor power. That’s just to take the power draw off the PCM. R812 doesn’t say that’s illegal.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T23:34:31.056Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":26.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Derek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16147,"username":"Thad_House","name":"Thad House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51079,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/12","custom_user_title":"Co-Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016523,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T23:43:11.328Z","cooked":"

I think he understood perfectly well. I think that’s a good Q&A question at best. Electrically speaking, would it work? Yeah probably. Is there a safety concern? None that I can think of. Is it legal per the rules? I’m not certain. As an inspector, I’d certainly call attention to it, as I’ve never seen it done that way before. It’d be an LRI decision for sure

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T23:43:11.328Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":40.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":404570,"topic_slug":"using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51079,"username":"NagloKehn","name":"Derek","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b2d939/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/using-old-ctre-pcm-in-2022/404570/13","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016535,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T23:59:31.278Z","cooked":"

This seems to violate R712:

R712 *Control PWM controllers from the roboRIO. Every relay module (per R503-B), servo controller,
and PWM motor controller shall be connected to a corresponding port (relays to Relay ports,
servo controllers and PWM controllers to PWM ports) on the roboRIO (either directly or through a
WCP Spartan Sensor Board) or via a legal MXP connection (per R713). They shall not be
controlled by signals from any other source, with the exception of the Nidec Dynamo motor
controller which must also be connected to the roboRIO Digital I/O.

Fletch1373:

Electrically speaking, would it work? Yeah probably

This actually depends on if the switch input of the relay is rated for 12 volts. Since the Rio output is 5 volts, I expect that to be the input rating, and passing 12 volts could damage the relay and make it unsafe.
